item.title: Don't be a "fixer."
item.dc:creator: Anton Checkhov
item.content:encoded:
Don't be a "fixer."

Some people just can't say no. They make themselves constantly available
to others as a means of boosting job security or feeling validated at
work. In the end, it devalues their time and leaves their to-do list
full.

http://feedproxy.google.com/~r/DumbLittleMan/~3/E3CcI6qWQTU/hey-got-second-ho...
